intro: Disterigma cuspidatum, commonly known as the spiny disterigma, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and distinctive spiny leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in dry, open habitats.
